result.execSummary:
The defendant James V Bonner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 8 days sentence credit.

Court will authorize the defendant's return to the State of Michigan immediately.
Court will allow for transfer to the State of Michigan.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Character Letter, received and filed in court.

Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James V Bonner in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 11 & 12 are dismissed as read ins.



Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
8 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  15 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to the State of Michigan.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the Posting Party.

Court authorizes the defendant's return to the State of Michigan following court today.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
